name: gce_disk_export
short_description: Export disk image/s from a GCP project to Google Cloud Storage.
description:
Creates disk images from a Google compute persistence disks, compress the images and export them to Google Cloud Storage.

The exported images names are appended by .tar.gz.

The service account [PROJECT-NR]@cloudbuild.gserviceaccount.com in the source project or in analysis project if analysis project is provided, must have the IAM role [Srorage Admin] on the destination storage bucket/folder.
args: Source project containing the disk to export.

Google Cloud Storage parent bucket/folder of the exported image. Service Account [PROJECT-NUMBER]@cloudbuild.gserviceaccount.com, in source project or in analysis project if analysis project is provided, must have sufficient rights on the output bucket, these rights are default if the bucket belongs to the source/analysis project.
Project where the disk image is created then exported. If not exist, source_project_name will be used.
Comma-separated list of disk names to export. If not exist, disks attahced to remote_instance_name will be used.
Instance in source project to export its disks. If not exist, disk_names will be used.
True if all disks attached to the source instance should be copied. If False and remote_instance_name is provided it will select the instance's boot disk.

Name of the output file, must comply with ^[A-Za-z0-9-]*$' and '.tar.gz' will be appended to the name. If not exist or if more than one disk is selected, exported image name as exported-image-{TIMESTAMP('%Y%m%d%H%M%S')}
